intro: Heteropyxis natalensis, commonly known as Natal hakea, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, cone-like inflorescences. The plant produces small, white or cream-colored flowers that attract birds and insects. It is typically found in rocky or sandy soils in coastal and mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
